definition: to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
pooh/pah/bah/(today used as a phonetic component in 部[bu4], 倍[bei4], 培[pei2], 剖[pou1] etc)
to accompany one's child or spouse who is studying overseas/to help a child with their study, reading or practicing together
to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
to be buried with or next to dead person (of deceased's partner, or of funerary objects)
funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)
provisional capital of a country (e.g. in time of war)/secondary capital/alternative capital
to look after a hospitalized loved one
dowry/to give as a dowry/to accompany sb

sentences.english: Shepherd's purse green season, and grandmother would have to accompany her mother to pick the fields shepherd's purse.
sentences.chinese: 薺菜青青時節，外婆便要母親陪着去田野裏挑薺菜。

sentences.english: One day if I cannot take your umbrella that I will accompany you in the rain.
sentences.chinese: 有天如果我不能替你撐傘那我就陪你淋雨。

sentences.english: Idou't promise to ask you to stop…But I can run with you.
sentences.chinese: 我不保證會使你笑，但我可以陪着你一起哭。

sentences.english: Stubborn smiled, said, rarely going at once, to accompany her.
sentences.chinese: 倔強的笑着，說，難得去一次，好好陪她啊。

sentences.english: I'll come walking with you in an hour or so.
sentences.chinese: 我大約一個鐘頭以後就來陪你散步。

sentences.english: He would be there for you , every day and every night.
sentences.chinese: 每一個白天，夜晚，他都陪着你。

sentences.english: Qin Ma said she was to accompany her to get here.
sentences.chinese: 秦媽說自己是爲了陪她纔來到這裏。

sentences.english: Doug: Do you need someone to come along with you? I'm free tonight.
sentences.chinese: 需要有人陪你嗎？我今天晚上有空喔。

sentences.english: 6 and the landlord with new tenant at the house.
sentences.chinese: 房東陪着新房客在看屋子。

sentences.english: One Friday, 12-year-old Janet was going to stay all night with her friend Amy.
sentences.chinese: 一個週五，12歲的珍妮特要陪她的朋友艾米過夜。

sentences.english: I appreciate that you working hard, but pls make time for me .
sentences.chinese: 你要先努力工作，然後儘量抽時間陪我。

sentences.english: Pleases allow me to arrange a tour for you. We can go together.
sentences.chinese: 請允許我爲你安排一次觀光，我可以陪你。

sentences.english: On the second day in early morning, three madams accompany square the madam come to give too madam to send greeting.
sentences.chinese: 第二天一大早，三夫人陪着方夫人來給太夫人請安。

sentences.english: If I have to not give up, you will not accompany me until the heavens down.
sentences.chinese: 如果我一直堅持不放棄，你會不會陪我撐到天塌下去。

sentences.english: I companion her to seek doctor Xie to see attach.
sentences.chinese: 我陪她一起去找謝大夫看看去。

sentences.english: Tiger went out to Istyle Town with me that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天老虎同學陪我再次去意街玩。

definition: to (try to) find the time to
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to visit/to pay a call to
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
to pass/to spend (time)/to survive/to get through
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
